title: The Grand Mosque to the Al Azhar Mosque Welcomes "Lailatul Qadar" Evening Itikaf Congregants - Kompas.id
text: [›](/) [English](/kategori/english)›The Grand Mosque to the Al... The Grand Mosque to the Al Azhar Mosque Welcomes "Lailatul Qadar" Evening Itikaf Congregants There are 15 million people who have registered for Itikaf at the Nabawi Mosque. Everyone wants to find "lailatul qadar". About AI Translated Article Please note that this article was automatically translated using Microsoft Azure AI, Open AI, and Google Translation AI. We cannot ensure that the entire content is translated accurately. If you spot any errors or inconsistencies, contact us at [hotline@kompas.id](mailto:hotline@kompas.id), and we'll make every effort to address them. Thank you for your understanding. MEKKAH, FRIDAY — The management of the [Haram Mosque](https://www.kompas.id/label/masjidil-haram?open_from=automate_body_url) in Mecca, the Al Azhar Mosque in Cairo, and the Jamia Mosque or Five Dome Mosque in Quetta are preparing to welcome the evening [lailatul qadar](https://www.kompas.id/label/lailatul-qadar?open_from=automate_body_url). The management is assisted by thousands of volunteers to serve a surge of up to tens of millions of congregation members. Reported by the Saudi Press Agency (SPA) on Friday (29/3/2024), the managers of Masjidil Haram and Masjid Nabawi are preparing to welcome the last two weeks of Ramadan. A surge is estimated to occur starting from today until the last day of Ramadan.
